trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with RunMyProcess | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with RunMyProcess | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use RunMyProcess with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use RunMyProcess with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and RunMyProcess.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and RunMyProcess.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A RunMyProcess tenant
trans-unit.target: A RunMyProcess tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to RunMyProcess will be able to single sign into the application at your RunMyProcess company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to RunMyProcess will be able to single sign into the application at your RunMyProcess company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for RunMyProcess
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for RunMyProcess

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for RunMyProcess.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for RunMyProcess.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type RunMyProcess.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type RunMyProcess.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select RunMyProcess, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select RunMyProcess, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RunMyProcess</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RunMyProcess</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to RunMyProcess with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to RunMyProcess with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the RunMyProcess application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the RunMyProcess application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to RunMyProcess page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to RunMyProcess page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the RunMyProcess Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.runmyprocess.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the RunMyProcess Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.runmyprocess.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at RunMyProcess page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at RunMyProcess page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your RunMyProcess company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your RunMyProcess company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Account \> Configuration.
trans-unit.target: Go to Account \> Configuration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Authentication method tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Authentication method tab.

trans-unit.source: In the Authentication method section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Authentication method section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SSO</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SSO</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As Method, select SSO with Samlv2.
trans-unit.target: As Method, select SSO with Samlv2.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at RunMyProcess dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the SSO redirect textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at RunMyProcess dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the SSO redirect textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at RunMyProcess dialog page, copy the Single Sign-Out Service URL value, and then paste it into the Logout redirect textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at RunMyProcess dialog page, copy the Single Sign-Out Service URL value, and then paste it into the Logout redirect textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Name id Format textbox, type urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress.
trans-unit.target: In the Name id Format textbox, type urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.1:nameid-format:emailAddress.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Certificate textbox
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the Certificate textbox

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into RunMyProcess, they must be provisioned into RunMyProcess.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into RunMyProcess, they must be provisioned into RunMyProcess.

trans-unit.source: In the case of RunMyProcess, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of RunMyProcess, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your RunMyProcess company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your RunMyProcess company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Account \> Users, and then click New User.
trans-unit.target: Go to Account \> Users, and then click New User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the User Settings section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the User Settings section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Profile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Profile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Name and E-mail of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the Name and E-mail of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Select an IDE language, a Language and a Profile.
trans-unit.target: Select an IDE language, a Language and a Profile.

trans-unit.source: Select Send account creation e-mail to me.
trans-unit.target: Select Send account creation e-mail to me.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other RunMyProcess user account creation tools or APIs provided by RunMyProcess to provision Azure Active Directory user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other RunMyProcess user account creation tools or APIs provided by RunMyProcess to provision Azure Active Directory user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the RunMyProcess **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the RunMyProcess **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
